org.sandag.popsyn.balancer
Class BalanceObjsSelector

java.lang.Object
  org.sandag.popsyn.balancer.BalanceObjsSelector

public class BalanceObjsSelector
extends java.lang.Object

The balance object selector chooses balance objects (households and GQs) in a way that their weights won't subsequently be balanced to very small fractional values. Households and GQs are selected separately, but at the end they are combined as one balance object set and used in the subsequent balance step.

zTargets

protected java.util.Hashtable<IControlDefinition<Household>,java.lang.Double> zTargets
The zonal control targets that the balancer is trying to match. This field is a HashTable that maps between control definitions (objects that implement IControlDefinition) and the target values (in the form of a Double) that correspond to each definition.

Constructor Detail

BalanceObjsSelector

public BalanceObjsSelector(int bzone,
                           java.util.Hashtable<IControlDefinition<Household>,java.lang.Double> theZTargets,
                           Classifier aClassifier,
                           int aPuma,
                           Version aVersion,
                           double theZonalHHTotal,
                           double theZonalGQTotal,
                           org.sandag.common.montecarlo.RandomSeedManager<java.lang.Integer> rdm)
Constructs a new BalanceObjsSelector object with the specified balance zone, zonal control targets, Classifier, PUMA ID, Version, zonal household total, zonal group quarters total, and RandomSeedManager.

Parameters:
bzone - an integer equaling the balance zone ID
theZTargets - the zonal control targets that the balancer is trying to match. This takes the form of a HashTable that maps between control definitions (objects that implement IControlDefinition) and the target values (in the form of a Double) that correspond to each definition
aClassifier - a Classifier object- classifies PUMS households/GQ by control category
aPuma - PUMA ID of the PUMA (which contains the balance zone) to select balance objects from
aVersion - a Version object- stores parameter/version information for this PopSyn run
theZonalHHTotal - a double equaling the zonal household total
theZonalGQTotal - a double equaling the zonal group quarters total
rdm - a RandomSeedManager object, which ensures that seeds used for random number generation are the same across PopSyn runs
Method Detail

getBalanceObjs

public java.util.Set<Household> getBalanceObjs()
Gets the balance objects (households and group quarters) that have been selected

Returns:
Returns a Set of Household objects that represent the chosen balance objects

setBalanceObjs

private void setBalanceObjs()
Chooses balance objects according to the following steps: Retrieves the classified objects from the particular PUMA, selects balance objects from among the classified objects, then adds the selected objects to the balanceObjs Set of Household objects.

selectObjs

private java.util.Set<Household> selectObjs(int zonalTotal,
                                            java.util.List<ControlList> classifiedObjs)
Selects balance objects in a way that their weights won't be balanced to very small fractional values.

Parameters:
zonalTotal - The zonal household total or the zonal group quarters total
classifiedObjs - The pool of classified objects from the PUMA to select from
Returns:
Returns a set of Household objects that have been selected

selectObjFromEachControl

private java.util.Set<Household> selectObjFromEachControl(java.util.List<ControlList> classifiedObjs)
Selects one object for each control category. This guarantees that all controls are balanced if the control targets are greater than 0. Without this step, sometimes the program can't find a Household object to balance for some controls due to the randomness of the selection procedure. The selection uses a random procedure, assuming that all Household objects are equally weighted. If no Household object is found for a given control, then select another PUMA randomly and then select an object for the control.

Parameters:
classifiedObjs - The classified objects to select from
Returns:
Returns a HashSet of selected balance objects

selectObjFromOtherPumas

private Household selectObjFromOtherPumas(IControlDefinition<Household> def)
Selects another PUMA randomly and then selects a balance object for the given control. If a qualifying Household object is not found in the PUMA, then another PUMA is randomly selected. This search continues until all PUMAs are exhausted.

Parameters:
def - The control definition that the selected object should meet
Returns:
returns a randomly selected Household object

selectRandomHousehold

private Household selectRandomHousehold(java.util.Set<Household> set)
Selects a random Household object from a Set of Household objects

Parameters:
set - the Set of Household objects to randomly select from
Returns:
returns a randomly selected Household object

calPumsVal

public static double calPumsVal(java.util.Set<Household> hhs,
                                IControlDefinition<Household> def)
Sums the weights of balance objects

Parameters:
hhs - the set of balance objects to sum the weights of
def - the control category that balance objects must participate in if their weights are to be summed
Returns:
returns the summation of weights over all balance objects
